snippet: The foreign ministers of Russia, Germany and Poland said they were optimistic while President Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine proposed setting up a corridor to help people flee the violence.
abstract: Foreign ministers of Russia, Poland and Germany signal progress toward a cease-fire in Ukraine, even as up to 40 separatists are reported to have been killed in fierce battle in the east of the country.

byline.original: By ANDREW E. KRAMER and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer reported from Donetsk, and David M. Herszenhorn from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The foreign ministers of Russia, Germany and Poland said they were optimistic while President Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine proposed setting up a corridor to help people flee the violence.

headline.main: Despite Clash in Ukraine, Cease-Fire Talks Advance
headline.print_headline: Despite Clash in Ukraine, Cease-Fire Talks Advance
